result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Kimmons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 6 months to pay or return to court for contempt proceedings or new charge for contempt.

Work Crew.
In default, 5 days KCJ.  Huber allowed.
Costs are rolled into sentence.
Expunction hrg on 4/7/17 @ 9am.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Kimmons

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  No appearance by deft.  No action taken on expunction request.
Defaulted on work crew for mandatory sentence. No show No call per WC.
Restitution released to victim.  /  CK# 16CH076217
Work Crew start date is 6/6/16 @ 8am.
Notified DA Office (rw) about alternative of not paying restitution w/n 6 months.

Restitution Determined - $360.40
This total does not include 10% surcharge due Kenosha Co. Clerk of Courts.
For Resitution Order
Hearing on April 7, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty James Fields-Bowers.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty to the charge; found guilty by the Court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 5 days work crew.  To report on 6/6/16 @ 8am.  In default, 5 days KCJ.  Huber allowed.  Costs rolled into sentence.  Restitution ordered.  Deft stipulates to $360.40 at this time.  Any add'l restitution requested will have to be submitted by the State.  Bond to apply to restitution.  Balance to be paid w/in 6mos.  Failure to pay restitution may result in return to court for contempt proceedings or new charge for contempt.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Expunction hrg 4/7/17 @ 9am.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty James Fields-Bowers.  Deft admonished about keeping in contact w/his atty.  FPT 4/8/16 @ 10:30am, JS 4/25/16 @ 9am.
Further proceedings at 02-25-2016 11:00 am

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk:  JT.  Warrant vacated.  Plea of not guilty previously entered.  Deft demands jury trial.  Referred to 2-25-16 for further proceedings in Br. 3 @ 11:00 am.  $250 contd posted cash bond with conditions.
DE posted bond of $250 and was given a mandatory court date of 02-18-16 at 1pm Intake.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Atty James Fields-Bowers appeared on behalf of deft.  No appearance by deft.  BW authorized; $250 cash bond.  Prior bond forfeited.  JS removed from the Court's calendar.  On the Court's own motion, the words "african american" will be stricken from the complaint.

If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Plea of not guilty entered by the Court.
